LOCATION: The Hammock Hotel Fine Arts Museum
Address: 59-61 Nguyen Thai Binh Street, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A stylish hotel located near the Fine Arts Museum.
Long Description: Tucked away in the heart of District 1, The Hammock Hotel Fine Arts Museum is a stylish boutique hotel that blends comfort with creative flair. Just steps from the Fine Arts Museum, it’s a perfect spot for art lovers and urban explorers alike. The hotel’s modern minimalist design is complemented by colorful hammocks hanging in each room—a fun and quirky touch. Guests enjoy free snacks, instant noodles, and a rooftop lounge with panoramic city views. With friendly staff and a laid-back vibe, it feels more like a friend’s cool apartment than a hotel. The location is ideal for walking to Ben Thanh Market, Bui Vien Street, or grabbing a bite at a nearby cafe. Each room is thoughtfully decorated and comes with comfy beds and a rain shower. The atmosphere is peaceful, despite being in the bustling city center. Whether you're a solo traveler or a couple, it’s a cozy base for discovering Saigon. It’s a hidden gem with excellent value and creative soul.

Address: 76 Le Lai Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A luxury hotel offering modern rooms and a rooftop pool.
Long Description: New World Saigon Hotel is a luxurious escape in the center of Ho Chi Minh City, offering five-star comfort with a touch of Vietnamese elegance. Located near Ben Thanh Market, it’s perfectly positioned for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel boasts spacious rooms, a massive outdoor pool, and a top-rated fitness center. Guests can indulge in diverse culinary experiences, from Chinese delicacies at Dynasty Restaurant to international dishes at Parkview Café. The executive lounge on the top floor offers a tranquil retreat with stunning city views. Service here is consistently praised for being warm and professional. Whether you're attending a conference or unwinding after sightseeing, the ambiance is both sophisticated and welcoming. Its grand lobby and stylish interiors make a lasting impression. For those who enjoy a mix of tradition and luxury, this hotel hits the mark. It’s where classic hospitality meets modern convenience.

LOCATION: Brand New Cozy Home at the heart of SG
Address: 100/10 Le Thi Rieng Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A cozy apartment right in the heart of Saigon.
Long Description: This charming and newly furnished apartment offers a warm, homelike experience right in the center of Ho Chi Minh City. Located just minutes away from District 1’s major attractions, it’s ideal for travelers who want privacy, comfort, and a local feel. The decor is simple but tasteful, with soft lighting and clean finishes throughout. It features a well-equipped kitchen, a cozy living space, and a comfy bed that guarantees a good night’s sleep. Whether you're staying short-term or long-term, it provides the calm of a home in the heart of the city buzz. It’s perfect for digital nomads, couples, or solo adventurers looking to unwind after a day of exploration. A balcony view or large windows let in plenty of natural light. The host is known to be responsive and thoughtful, offering tips to make your stay smoother. This hidden retreat offers hotel-like convenience with the warmth of a personal home. It’s a peaceful pocket in a vibrant city.

Address: 35/2 Bui Vien Street, Pham Ngu Lao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A friendly and budget hostel for travelers.
Long Description: Loan Vo Hostel is a budget-friendly gem that’s big on warmth and hospitality. Tucked in a quiet alley but close to the action, it’s a peaceful retreat from the city’s fast pace. The rooms are clean and basic, perfect for backpackers or budget travelers. What makes this hostel shine is its owner, Ms. Loan, who treats guests like family. She often helps with travel tips, motorbike rentals, or even homemade Vietnamese meals. Despite the simple setup, the place has a welcoming charm that makes you feel instantly at ease. Many guests return not just for the price, but for the personal touch. It’s walking distance to several attractions, but also a great base to explore hidden local spots. There’s a shared kitchen and common space to meet other travelers. If you're looking for an affordable stay with genuine heart, this is the place.

Address: 141 Nguyen Hue Boulevard, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A historic hotel known for its classic charm.
Long Description: Rex Hotel is one of Saigon’s most iconic hotels, rich in history and grandeur. Originally a French colonial building, it gained fame during the Vietnam War as a hub for journalists. Today, it’s a five-star destination offering elegant rooms and top-tier amenities. Located on Nguyen Hue Walking Street, it places guests at the cultural center of the city. Its rooftop bar offers stunning views of downtown Saigon and is perfect for an evening cocktail. The lobby and interiors blend old-world charm with modern touches. Guests can relax at the spa, work out at the gym, or enjoy high-end dining at the in-house restaurants. With a legacy that spans decades, staying here feels like being part of Saigon’s living history. The service is refined, and the atmosphere is one of understated luxury. It’s an ideal choice for travelers who appreciate both comfort and character.

Address: 1 Dong Khoi Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A riverside hotel with colonial architecture and luxury services.
Long Description: Hotel Majestic Saigon is a timeless symbol of elegance and charm, perfectly positioned along the scenic Saigon River. Established in 1925, this historic hotel blends French colonial architecture with modern luxury, creating an atmosphere of old-world sophistication. The grand lobby, with its marble floors and vintage chandeliers, immediately transports visitors to a bygone era. Rooms are tastefully decorated, offering river or city views, and are equipped with all the comforts a traveler could desire. The rooftop bar is a highlight, offering stunning panoramic views of the city skyline, especially enchanting at sunset. Hotel Majestic also boasts several excellent dining options, including authentic Vietnamese and Western cuisine. Its prime location means you're within walking distance of many famous landmarks, such as the Opera House and Nguyen Hue Walking Street. Whether you’re sipping a cocktail by the pool or enjoying afternoon tea, every moment here feels steeped in history. For travelers who appreciate a blend of heritage and luxury, Hotel Majestic Saigon is truly unforgettable.

Address: 2A-4A Ton Duc Thang Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A 5-star hotel with stunning river views and top facilities.
Long Description: Lotte Hotel Saigon stands as a shining example of modern luxury in the heart of District 1. Overlooking the Saigon River, the hotel offers a peaceful retreat while still being close to the city’s vibrant attractions. The spacious rooms are designed with contemporary elegance, featuring large windows that let in plenty of natural light and offer sweeping city or river views. Guests can indulge in a range of facilities, from the beautiful outdoor pool surrounded by tropical gardens to the full-service spa offering relaxing treatments. Dining options are plentiful, with restaurants serving everything from Japanese sushi to international buffets. The service here is consistently praised for being attentive and warm, making guests feel truly cared for. Whether you're traveling for business or leisure, Lotte Hotel provides the perfect mix of comfort, style, and convenience. It's a haven where luxury feels effortless, and relaxation comes naturally. For a refined stay in Ho Chi Minh City, Lotte Hotel is hard to beat.

Address: 3-5 Suong Nguyet Anh Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Modern suites offering a relaxing stay in Saigon.
Long Description: Fusion Suites Saigon is a breath of fresh air for travelers seeking a modern, wellness-focused retreat in the middle of bustling Ho Chi Minh City. The hotel is known for its sleek, minimalist design, featuring natural wood tones, large windows, and soothing color palettes that promote relaxation. Each room is a cozy, stylish haven, complete with spa-like bathrooms and comfortable lounges. What sets Fusion Suites apart is its signature offering: complimentary spa treatments included with your stay, allowing guests to truly unwind. The on-site restaurant focuses on healthy, delicious meals, emphasizing fresh ingredients and vibrant flavors. The rooftop terrace is a perfect spot for evening drinks or yoga sessions with a city view. Located near Tao Dan Park and the War Remnants Museum, it’s well-placed for sightseeing yet tucked away enough to feel peaceful. Friendly staff add a personal touch, making guests feel right at home. Fusion Suites Saigon is ideal for those wanting to recharge both body and mind during their city adventure.

Address: 2 Hong Ha Street, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Convenient hotel just steps from Tan Son Nhat Airport.
Long Description: ibis Saigon Airport is the perfect choice for travelers seeking convenience, comfort, and affordability near Tan Son Nhat International Airport. Just a short walk from the terminals, the hotel offers modern, functional rooms that are stylishly designed with vibrant colors and cozy beds. The rooftop swimming pool and bar are standout features, offering great views of planes taking off and landing—a unique and surprisingly relaxing sight. There's also a gym and a sauna for guests who want to unwind before or after a flight. The hotel’s 24-hour restaurant serves a variety of tasty local and international dishes, ideal for travelers arriving at odd hours. Service is efficient and friendly, making your transit smooth and hassle-free. Whether you’re catching an early flight or arriving late, ibis Saigon Airport offers everything you need for a comfortable stay. Plus, it’s just a short taxi ride to downtown Saigon if you have time to explore. For stress-free travel, it’s a top pick.

Address: 11 Cuu Long Street, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Affordable stay with easy access to the airport.
Long Description: The Airport Hotel is a cozy and convenient spot tailored for travelers seeking an easy stopover near Tan Son Nhat International Airport. With its clean, comfortable rooms and efficient service, it provides everything needed for a restful night’s sleep before or after a long journey. Rooms are simple yet well-equipped with soft beds, strong Wi-Fi, and essential amenities like tea-making facilities and a desk. Guests appreciate the hotel's free airport shuttle service, which makes catching flights incredibly easy. The friendly staff go out of their way to assist with check-ins, transportation, and even local tips for nearby food and shopping. Despite being close to the airport, the rooms are surprisingly quiet, ensuring a peaceful stay. Breakfast is included, offering a variety of local and Western options to start your day right. It’s also well-positioned if you want a quick trip into the city without staying downtown. For travelers in transit, The Airport Hotel offers excellent value and convenience.

Address: 202 Hoang Van Thu Street, Ward 9, Phu Nhuan District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Comfortable rooms near the airport for business travelers.
Long Description: TTC Hotel - Airport offers a balanced blend of affordability, comfort, and convenience for those passing through Ho Chi Minh City. Located just minutes from Tan Son Nhat Airport, the hotel makes it easy for guests to rest and recharge before their next journey. The rooms are bright, spacious, and equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay, including free Wi-Fi, large beds, and modern bathrooms. A highlight of the hotel is its warm hospitality, with staff who are happy to assist with travel arrangements, luggage storage, and airport transfers. The on-site restaurant serves tasty Vietnamese and international dishes, so you don’t have to venture far for a good meal. Despite its proximity to the airport, the hotel maintains a quiet, relaxing atmosphere inside. If you have a little more time, the hotel's location also provides quick access to local cafes and shopping areas. TTC Hotel - Airport is a solid choice for a worry-free and comfortable layover.

Address: 120 Hanoi Highway, Tan Phu Ward, Thu Duc City, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A vibrant amusement park with family-friendly attractions.
Long Description: Suoi Tien Theme Park is a magical blend of Vietnamese mythology, colorful architecture, and family-friendly fun. Located in Thu Duc City, this cultural amusement park offers a unique experience that goes beyond your typical theme park. Statues of dragons, phoenixes, and legendary figures line the paths, each telling a story from Vietnamese folklore. Visitors can enjoy thrilling rides, water slides, and even a man-made beach. The park also features temples, spiritual zones, and educational attractions, making it a place for both entertainment and cultural learning. It’s especially vibrant during holidays like Tet, with special shows and decorations. Children love the Fairy Castle and Dinosaur Garden, while adults appreciate the peaceful bonsai gardens. There's a whimsical, surreal charm that makes every corner of the park feel like a fantasy world. Whether you're a family with kids or a curious traveler, Suoi Tien offers a day full of surprises. It's an unforgettable part of Saigon's more playful side.

Address: 3 Hoa Binh Street, Ward 3, District 11, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A popular theme park with water rides and gardens.
Long Description: Dam Sen Cultural Park is a classic Saigon destination that combines amusement rides, lush gardens, and cultural performances. Located in District 11, it's been a favorite weekend getaway for locals for decades. The park is divided into two main areas: Dam Sen Park and Dam Sen Water Park, offering both dry and wet adventures. You can paddle across the swan lake, take a ride on the giant Ferris wheel, or get soaked in wave pools and water slides. Its flower gardens and mini replicas of famous landmarks make great photo spots. There's also a Roman-style stage that hosts music and dance shows. The atmosphere is cheerful and perfect for families, couples, or groups of friends. It's not as modern as newer parks, but that’s part of its charm—nostalgic and full of character. Local street food stalls around the area add flavor to your visit. A day at Dam Sen feels like stepping into Saigon’s playful, vibrant soul.

Address: 189 Nguyen Van Linh Street, Tan Thuan Tay Ward, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: An exciting water park perfect for family fun.
Long Description: Amazing Bay is a waterpark wonderland located just outside Ho Chi Minh City, offering fun and relaxation for all ages. With one of the largest wave pools in Southeast Asia, it’s a perfect escape from the city heat. The park boasts exciting slides, lazy rivers, and splash zones that keep kids and adults entertained for hours. Its design mixes tropical themes with modern facilities, creating a resort-like atmosphere. There are plenty of shaded lounging areas where you can unwind between rides. The safety measures and cleanliness of the park are also frequently praised. Whether you’re plunging down a high-speed water slide or floating under palm trees, the experience is both thrilling and refreshing. Cafés and food courts are available on-site for a convenient meal. Families often spend a full day here, soaking up sun and laughter. It’s a great day trip that leaves everyone smiling.
Ticket Info: Prices vary; refer to official site for details

Address: Nguyen Hue Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A lively pedestrian street with shops and cafes.
Long Description: Nguyen Hue Walking Street is the beating heart of modern Saigon, a wide pedestrian boulevard filled with energy, lights, and life. Stretching from the Saigon River to City Hall, it’s a favorite spot for locals and tourists to stroll, snap photos, or enjoy street performances. By day, it’s a scenic urban space framed by historic buildings and high-end cafes. At night, it transforms into a vibrant social hub, with fountains lit up and music filling the air. You’ll find food vendors, dancers, skaters, and sometimes even art displays right on the street. It’s also the stage for major public events and holiday celebrations, such as Lunar New Year. The nearby “Cafe Apartment” building is a unique highlight, with each balcony hiding a trendy cafe or boutique. It’s safe, clean, and perfect for people-watching or just soaking in the city’s pulse. A visit to Ho Chi Minh City isn’t complete without spending an evening here. It’s where the city comes alive.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending
open_hour: Open 24/7; best visited during daylight hours

Address: 720A Dien Bien Phu Street, Ward 22, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Vietnam’s tallest building with shops, restaurants, and a sky deck.
Long Description: Landmark 81 towers above Ho Chi Minh City as Vietnam’s tallest building and a symbol of modern ambition. Located in the Vinhomes Central Park complex, it stands at an impressive 461.2 meters, offering stunning views of the city skyline. The building houses luxury residences, shopping malls, restaurants, and a five-star hotel. One of its top attractions is the SkyView Observatory, where visitors can gaze out over the Saigon River and beyond. Inside, you'll find international fashion brands, gourmet dining, and entertainment zones, including an ice rink. At night, the building lights up beautifully, visible from miles away and often photographed against colorful sunsets. The surrounding park offers walking paths, gardens, and riverside views for a relaxing contrast to the skyscraper’s grandeur. Landmark 81 is more than just height—it’s a lifestyle destination. It reflects the rapid growth and global outlook of Vietnam’s biggest city. For both visitors and locals, it’s a must-see icon of the new Saigon.

Address: Pham Ngu Lao Street, Pham Ngu Lao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A green park ideal for relaxing in downtown Saigon.
Long Description: 23/9 Park, also known as September 23rd Park, is a peaceful green space in the middle of bustling District 1. Once the site of a train station, it’s now a popular gathering spot for locals to relax, exercise, or enjoy street performances. The park stretches along Pham Ngu Lao Street, making it a convenient stop for backpackers staying nearby. In the early morning, you’ll see people practicing tai chi or jogging beneath the shade of tall trees. During the evening, the park comes alive with couples strolling, students chatting, and families enjoying the cool air. Benches line the walkways, and there's plenty of open space for informal games or picnics. Occasionally, the park hosts festivals, markets, and community events. It offers a refreshing break from the city's fast pace and traffic noise. Whether you're sipping a takeaway coffee or just people-watching, it’s a nice slice of everyday Saigon. It’s not flashy, but it’s part of the city's rhythm.
open_hour: Open 24/7; best visited during daylight hours

Address: Bach Dang Wharf, Ton Duc Thang Street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A scenic boat tour showcasing Saigon’s beauty.
Long Description: A Saigon River tour offers a unique way to experience Ho Chi Minh City from the water, where the city’s contrast truly comes to life. You’ll cruise past colonial buildings, bustling piers, modern skyscrapers, and quiet neighborhoods all in one ride. Options range from quick sightseeing trips to romantic dinner cruises under the stars. Sunset tours are especially popular, with golden light casting a magical glow over the skyline. Some tours stop at hidden gems like local fishing villages, ancient pagodas, or even Cu Chi Tunnels. Onboard, you can enjoy live music, traditional dance, or a multi-course Vietnamese meal depending on the package. The calm flow of the river offers a peaceful escape from the busy streets. It’s a chance to see the city from a new angle—both literally and culturally. Whether you're celebrating or just unwinding, the river is the perfect setting. It’s an experience you’ll remember long after you leave Saigon.

Address: 125 Dong Van Cong Street, Thanh My Loi Ward, Thu Duc City, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: An indoor snow playground for kids and families.
Long Description: Snow Town Saigon is a magical winter escape right in the heart of tropical Ho Chi Minh City. Located in District 2, this indoor snow park offers visitors the rare chance to experience real snow without leaving Vietnam. The park features gentle slopes perfect for sledding, snowball fights, and even building snowmen, making it a hit with both kids and adults. The temperature inside is kept chilly, providing a refreshing break from the city's usual heat. Snow Town also hosts fun seasonal events, like winter festivals and themed activities throughout the year. Beyond the snow zone, there are various play areas, VR games, and a food court serving warm, hearty meals. It’s a great spot for families, groups of friends, or anyone seeking a unique experience. The bright, colorful decor creates a cheerful atmosphere that feels festive no matter the season. For a few hours of frosty fun in Saigon, Snow Town is a must-visit destination.

Address: 2-4 Street No. 9, Tan Hung Ward, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A miniature city where kids can role-play real jobs.
Long Description: Vietopia is a vibrant indoor "city" where kids become the heroes of their own adventures. Designed as an educational entertainment center, Vietopia lets children role-play hundreds of real-world jobs, from doctors and pilots to chefs and firefighters. The miniature city is impressively detailed, complete with banks, hospitals, TV stations, and even a mini airport. Kids not only have a blast but also learn valuable life skills like teamwork, responsibility, and creativity. Parents can relax in the café area or watch their little ones dive into their roles with enthusiasm. The environment is safe, clean, and well-organized, making it a favorite for families. Regular events and seasonal festivals add to the excitement, ensuring that every visit feels new and exciting. Located conveniently in District 7, Vietopia offers a unique blend of fun and education. It’s the perfect day out for families with curious and energetic young explorers.

Address: Various locations across Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A colorful indoor playground for young children.
Long Description: tiNiWorld is a colorful wonderland designed to spark the imagination of young children. This chain of play centers across Ho Chi Minh City offers a wide variety of activities, from creative arts and crafts corners to active play zones with climbing frames and ball pits. Each tiNiWorld location is vibrant and thoughtfully laid out to encourage safe, interactive fun. Kids can engage in pretend play, dress up in costumes, or participate in group games, while parents can relax knowing their children are in a supervised environment. Educational activities like basic science experiments and storytelling sessions are also part of the daily offerings. Special themed days, holiday celebrations, and workshops keep the experience fresh and engaging. It’s an excellent spot for birthday parties or a simple afternoon adventure. Clean, friendly, and accessible, tiNiWorld has become a go-to destination for young families in Saigon. Here, every visit brings a new world of discovery and delight.

Address: 7 Lam Son Square, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: The city's leading venue for classical music and ballet.
Long Description: The Ho Chi Minh City Opera House, also known as the Municipal Theatre, is a stunning example of French colonial architecture and one of the city’s most beautiful landmarks. Built in 1897, it stands elegantly at the heart of District 1, with intricate carvings, grand arches, and a lavish interior adorned with crystal chandeliers and marble floors. The Opera House hosts a wide range of performances, from ballet and opera to contemporary dance and orchestral concerts, often featuring both local and international artists. The building itself exudes a romantic, old-world charm that makes any evening here feel special. Guided tours are available during the day for those interested in the history and architecture. At night, the illuminated facade adds a magical glow to the bustling streets around it. Attending a performance here offers not only entertainment but also a glimpse into Saigon’s rich cultural heritage. Whether you're an art lover or simply an admirer of beautiful spaces, the HCMC Opera House is a must-visit.
open_hour: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (Box Office); Performance times vary

Address: 76A Le Lai Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A trendy rooftop bar with stunning city views.
Long Description: Chill Sky Bar is one of Ho Chi Minh City’s most iconic nightlife destinations, offering breathtaking views from the top of the AB Tower. This glamorous rooftop bar is the perfect place to unwind with a cocktail while taking in the glittering cityscape. Known for its vibrant atmosphere, Chill Sky Bar combines stylish décor, great music, and a sophisticated crowd. As the sun sets and the city lights up, the energy rises with live DJ performances and a lively dance floor. The menu features a wide selection of creative drinks, premium spirits, and delicious bar bites. There’s also a dress code, adding an extra touch of elegance to the experience. Whether you're looking to celebrate a special occasion or simply enjoy a memorable night out, Chill Sky Bar delivers on both ambiance and excitement. It's a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience Saigon's nightlife at its finest. Get ready for an unforgettable evening high above the city!

Address: Bui Vien Street, Pham Ngu Lao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A famous nightlife street bustling with bars and clubs.
Long Description: Bui Vien Street, located in the bustling District 1, is the beating heart of Ho Chi Minh City’s backpacker scene. Often compared to Bangkok’s Khao San Road, Bui Vien comes alive at night with its neon lights, thumping music, and lively crowds. The street is lined with an endless array of bars, clubs, street food vendors, and quirky shops, creating an electrifying atmosphere that's both chaotic and thrilling. It's a place where you can grab a cheap beer, feast on delicious Vietnamese street food, and meet travelers from all over the world. The vibe here is unapologetically energetic, with live bands, DJs, and even impromptu street performances adding to the excitement. Despite its wild side, Bui Vien is also a great spot to people-watch and soak up the vibrant spirit of the city. Safety is generally good, but as with any crowded area, it’s smart to keep an eye on your belongings. Whether you stay for an hour or an entire night, a visit to Bui Vien Street is an unforgettable slice of Saigon life.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending
open_hour: Open 24/7; best visited during evening hours

Address: 147 Ton That Dam Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A premium e-gaming center with the latest tech.
Long Description: Club V E-Gaming offers a thrilling escape for gamers and entertainment seekers right in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City. This upscale gaming lounge features a wide range of electronic games, from classic favorites to the latest slot machines. The atmosphere is vibrant yet classy, with sleek interiors, comfortable seating, and ambient lighting that creates an exciting mood. Club V is known for its excellent service, with attentive staff ready to assist both seasoned players and newcomers. Complimentary drinks and snacks add a touch of luxury to the gaming experience. While the focus is on fun, the club maintains a professional and secure environment for all guests. It's conveniently located within a hotel complex, making it a popular stop for travelers looking to unwind. Whether you're feeling lucky or simply looking for a lively night out, Club V E-Gaming delivers high-energy entertainment in style. It’s a hotspot where excitement never sleeps.
Ticket Info: Entry fee varies; refer to official site for details

Address: 29 Le Thanh Ton Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A stylish casino and lounge for entertainment lovers.
Long Description: Monte-Carlo Saigon brings the glamour and excitement of a European casino to vibrant Ho Chi Minh City. Located within the stylish Hotel Grand Saigon, this exclusive gaming venue offers a premium experience with high-end gaming tables, slots, and private VIP rooms. The decor is sophisticated and elegant, featuring plush furnishings and a touch of classic luxury. Guests can enjoy a refined atmosphere where attention to detail and personalized service are top priorities. Whether you prefer baccarat, blackjack, or roulette, Monte-Carlo Saigon caters to all levels of players. The club also offers a selection of fine wines, cocktails, and gourmet snacks to elevate the experience. Discreet yet lively, it’s a favorite among both locals and international visitors looking for a sophisticated night out. With its blend of excitement and refinement, Monte-Carlo Saigon makes every visit feel like a special occasion. It's perfect for those who enjoy a touch of elegance with their entertainment.
Ticket Info: Entry fee varies; refer to official site for details

Address: 1-3 Phan Chu Trinh Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A famous spot where former President Bill Clinton once dined.
Long Description: Phở 2000 shot to fame after former U.S. President Bill Clinton dined there during his historic visit to Vietnam in 2000. Located near Ben Thanh Market, this casual eatery serves up one of Vietnam’s most beloved dishes—pho, the iconic noodle soup. The interior is simple and clean, with large windows and photos of Clinton proudly displayed on the wall. The broth is light yet flavorful, and the menu includes both beef and chicken options. Locals and tourists alike come for a quick, satisfying meal in the heart of the city. The service is fast, and prices are reasonable considering its fame. It’s not a fancy restaurant, but its story and taste keep people coming back. Eating here gives you a slice of culinary history along with your bowl. If you’re in District 1 and craving authentic pho with a side of presidential trivia, this is the spot. It’s pho with a little extra legend.

Address: 160 Pasteur Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A classic restaurant serving traditional Vietnamese dishes.
Long Description: Nhà hàng Ngon is a beloved restaurant that brings together regional Vietnamese street food in one elegant, colonial-style setting. Located on Pasteur Street in District 1, it's known for both its beautiful ambiance and its variety of authentic dishes. The open kitchen concept lets you watch chefs prepare everything from northern bun cha to central banh xeo and southern hu tieu. Wooden furnishings and antique touches create a warm, nostalgic atmosphere. It’s a great place to introduce visitors to Vietnamese cuisine in a clean, comfortable environment. The menu is extensive, and you could easily try five different dishes without leaving your seat. Despite its popularity with tourists, it’s also frequented by locals who appreciate the quality. Whether you're dining with friends or enjoying a quiet meal solo, the experience is both flavorful and cultural. Service is efficient, and the staff are helpful in explaining dishes. It’s a true culinary showcase of Vietnam under one roof.

Address: 26 Le Thi Rieng Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Legendary bakery known for its huge, delicious bánh mì.
Long Description: Often called the “king of bánh mì” in Saigon, Bánh mì Huỳnh Hoa is a legendary sandwich shop famous for its rich, overloaded baguettes. Located on Le Thi Rieng Street, the shop draws long lines of both locals and tourists throughout the day. Each bánh mì is packed with layers of cold cuts, pâté, mayo, pickled vegetables, fresh herbs, and a spicy kick from chili sauce. The bread is always perfectly crisp on the outside and soft inside. It’s a bit more expensive than your average street bánh mì, but most agree it’s worth every đồng. The staff work at lightning speed behind the glass, wrapping up sandwiches that feel more like a full meal. There’s little seating, so most people take it to-go and eat it on the street or nearby benches. It’s a must-try for foodies exploring Saigon’s vibrant street food scene. One bite, and you’ll understand why it has a cult following. It’s not just a snack—it’s a legend in a baguette.

Address: 27 Ngo Duc Ke Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A chic coffee shop perfect for remote work.
Long Description: Perched above a colonial building in downtown Saigon, The Workshop Coffee is a favorite haunt for coffee enthusiasts and remote workers alike. With its high ceilings, rustic wooden furniture, and industrial-chic aesthetic, the space feels both cozy and inspiring. The aroma of freshly roasted beans fills the air as baristas craft drinks using pour-over, siphon, or espresso methods. It’s not just about caffeine—it’s about the art and science behind every cup. The open brewing bar lets guests watch their coffee being made with care and precision. There’s also a menu of light bites and pastries, perfect for a mid-day break. Large windows bring in natural light and offer a view over the bustling streets below. It’s a quiet oasis in the middle of the city's chaos. Whether you’re working on a project or savoring a slow morning, it’s a place to stay awhile. The Workshop is where quality coffee meets quiet creativity.

Address: 47 Nguyen Hue Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A vintage-style cafe with great coffee and cozy vibes.
Long Description: Café de Saigon1982 blends vintage Saigon charm with a modern café experience, creating a nostalgic escape in the heart of the city. From the moment you step inside, you’re greeted with retro furniture, classic Vietnamese posters, and soft oldies music playing in the background. It feels like stepping back in time to a gentler, slower Saigon. The menu includes both traditional Vietnamese drinks like cà phê sữa đá and creative fusion beverages. They also serve light snacks and desserts in charming, vintage dishware. It’s a popular spot for locals who miss the old days and young folks who love the aesthetic. Whether you're coming to chat with friends or read a book in peace, the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. The staff are friendly and happy to recommend drinks if you're unsure. With every corner offering a photo-worthy moment, it's a hit with Instagram lovers too. Café de Saigon1982 is more than a café—it’s a vibe.

Address: 4 Phan Boi Chau Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A humble stall famous for its flavorful crab noodle soup.
Long Description: Bún Riêu Gánh is a humble roadside eatery that delivers bold, unforgettable flavors in every steaming bowl. Known for its rich crab-based broth, this spot serves up one of Saigon’s most beloved noodle soups with heart and soul. The soup is bright and tangy, with floating tomato chunks, soft tofu, and fragrant herbs. Generous scoops of minced crab and firm vermicelli noodles fill each bowl to the brim. It’s comfort food at its finest—simple, satisfying, and deeply flavorful. Despite its no-frills setup, the place is almost always packed with loyal customers. The small stools, fast service, and bustling street sounds make for an authentic Saigon dining experience. You’ll likely be elbow-to-elbow with locals slurping away happily. It's best enjoyed in the morning or late afternoon when the broth is at its freshest. If you want to taste the soul of the street, this is where you go.

Address: 18 Nguyen Canh Chan Street, Cau Kho Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A must-visit spot for authentic crab noodle lovers.
Long Description: Tucked away on Nguyễn Cảnh Chân Street, this local bún riêu spot is a hidden gem for fans of hearty, crab-based noodle soup. The broth here is intensely flavorful—savory, slightly sour, and brimming with umami from slow-simmered ingredients. What sets it apart is the balance: tender tofu, fresh tomato slices, and fluffy crab patties in every bowl. Topped with herbs, banana blossom, and a splash of chili oil, it’s a vibrant mix of textures and tastes. The space is modest but clean, and the service is fast and friendly. Locals often swing by for a quick, satisfying lunch or dinner. Portions are generous and prices are wallet-friendly, making it great for casual dining. It’s the kind of place where one bite turns you into a regular. Perfect for those who want to eat like a local. This is authentic Saigon comfort food, no bells or whistles—just flavor.

Address: 100 Tran Quang Khai Street, Tan Dinh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Singapore-style frog porridge with rich flavors.
Long Description: At Cháo Ếch Singapore Tân Định, you’ll find one of the most delicious cross-cultural culinary experiences in the city. The star of the menu is Singapore-style frog porridge—clay-pot-cooked frog legs glazed in thick, spicy soy sauce served with a side of creamy rice porridge. The frog meat is tender, slightly sweet, and infused with garlic and chili heat. It’s rich, aromatic, and totally different from typical Vietnamese fare. The cozy spot near Tan Dinh Market attracts both curious foodies and loyal regulars. Each clay pot arrives bubbling hot, filling the air with mouthwatering steam. The porridge itself is silky-smooth and comforting, a perfect contrast to the bold flavors of the frog. Service is quick, and the prices are reasonable for the generous portions. It’s a great place for late-night eats or a unique dinner outing. If you’re feeling adventurous, this dish might just surprise you—in the best way.

Address: 39 Bui Thi Xuan Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Crispy bánh mì sandwiches at a popular local spot.
Long Description: Bánh mì Bùi Thị Xuân is a hidden gem where you’ll find one of Saigon’s finest takes on the classic Vietnamese sandwich. Located on a busy street, this spot stands out not just for its excellent bánh mì but also for its generous, carefully layered fillings. The baguette is perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, holding together a tantalizing mix of grilled pork, pickled vegetables, fresh herbs, and a slather of pâté. What makes this place special is the personal touch—each sandwich is made with care, and the flavors are balanced just right. The ingredients are always fresh, and the meats are well-seasoned, offering a savory bite with a slight sweetness. It's a no-frills spot, where the focus is on quality and taste, not on fancy decor. Locals line up here during the lunch rush, but it’s definitely worth the wait. If you’re craving an authentic, mouthwatering bánh mì, this is the place to go. It’s not just a snack; it’s an experience.

Address: 55 Dong Du Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Dim sum and Chinese dishes served in a fine dining style.
Long Description: Dim Tu Tac is a beloved destination for lovers of authentic Cantonese cuisine in Ho Chi Minh City. Renowned for its delicate dim sum and flavorful Chinese dishes, the restaurant offers a warm, elegant setting perfect for family gatherings and business meals alike. Every dish here is crafted with fresh, premium ingredients and a dedication to traditional flavors. Popular items include juicy dumplings, crispy roast duck, and fragrant fried rice, all presented beautifully. The interior features tasteful decor with Chinese cultural touches, creating a sophisticated yet inviting atmosphere. Service is attentive, with staff eager to recommend specialties and pairings. Dim Tu Tac has several locations around the city, each maintaining the same high standards of quality and hospitality. Whether you're craving a hearty feast or a light dim sum brunch, this restaurant promises a memorable dining experience. It's a true gem for those seeking authentic Chinese culinary excellence in Saigon.

Address: 37 Ky Con Street, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Creative modern dishes served in an elegant setting.
Long Description: Quince Saigon is where rustic charm meets modern fine dining, offering a truly unique culinary experience. Tucked away in District 1, this chic restaurant is known for its wood-fired cooking and creative, Mediterranean-inspired menu. The open kitchen concept allows guests to watch the chefs at work, adding a lively, interactive element to the dining experience. Dishes are crafted with seasonal, locally sourced ingredients and presented with rustic elegance. The ambiance is both stylish and relaxed, with warm lighting, exposed brick walls, and cozy seating that invites long, leisurely meals. Signature dishes like slow-cooked lamb and charred vegetables are bursting with rich, smoky flavors. The wine list is thoughtfully curated, featuring both international labels and boutique finds. Service is knowledgeable and friendly, making every guest feel welcomed and well taken care of. Quince Saigon is the perfect spot for food lovers seeking bold flavors and a memorable night out in the city.

Address: 21 Phan Ke Binh Street, Da Kao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Exquisite Japanese fine dining experience.
Long Description: Kappou Nishiyama offers an exquisite journey into the world of traditional Japanese fine dining. Nestled in a quiet corner of Saigon, this intimate restaurant is led by a skilled Japanese chef dedicated to the kappou style—where the cooking process is as much a part of the experience as the food itself. Guests sit at the counter, watching the chef prepare each dish with precision and artistry. The multi-course meals highlight the finest seasonal ingredients, flown in directly from Japan when necessary. Expect dishes like delicate sashimi, perfectly grilled fish, and refined broths that celebrate simplicity and purity of flavor. The minimalist decor, featuring natural wood and soft lighting, enhances the serene, focused atmosphere. Dining at Kappou Nishiyama feels personal, almost ceremonial, creating a deep appreciation for each bite. Reservations are essential due to limited seating. For lovers of authentic, traditional Japanese cuisine, this is a hidden treasure in Ho Chi Minh City.

Address: 120 Nguyen Thai Binh Street, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Rich beef noodle soup that’s full of flavor.
Long Description: Pho Phu Vuong is a must-visit for anyone craving an authentic bowl of Vietnamese pho in Saigon. Tucked away in a simple yet charming eatery, this spot is beloved by locals for its rich, aromatic broth and tender slices of beef. The flavors are bold yet balanced, the kind that comes from hours of careful simmering. Unlike some touristy places, Pho Phu Vuong keeps it real, focusing on quality ingredients and traditional techniques. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, perfect for a comforting meal at any time of day. Garnishes like fresh herbs, lime, and chilies are served generously on the side for a personalized touch. The menu is straightforward, allowing the pho to shine without unnecessary distractions. Service is quick and friendly, making it ideal for a quick lunch or a late-night craving. Once you try it, you’ll understand why many consider this one of Saigon’s top pho spots. It’s pure, honest comfort in a bowl.

Address: 37 Nguyen Huu Cau Street, Tan Dinh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Savory chicken sticky rice beloved by locals.
Long Description: Xoi Ga Number One lives up to its name, serving what many locals claim is the best chicken sticky rice in town. This humble, bustling eatery is famous for its fragrant, perfectly cooked glutinous rice paired with juicy, flavorful chicken. Each plate is a satisfying mix of textures—sticky, tender, and slightly crispy when you add fried shallots on top. The flavors are rich and savory, with a hint of sweetness from the soy sauce drizzle. Despite its simple setting, Xoi Ga Number One consistently draws long lines, especially during breakfast and late-night hours. The prices are very affordable, making it a favorite among students and workers alike. Service is fast, ensuring you won't wait long even during busy times. Whether eaten as a hearty breakfast or a filling midnight snack, this dish never disappoints. It’s an authentic taste of Saigon’s vibrant street food culture. Bring your appetite—you'll want seconds.

Address: 1A Ton Duc Thang Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Cantonese cuisine with a luxurious touch.
Long Description: Kabin, located inside the Renaissance Riverside Hotel Saigon, is a luxurious destination for lovers of refined Cantonese cuisine. With its elegant decor featuring intricate woodwork, soft lighting, and traditional Chinese motifs, Kabin sets the stage for an upscale dining experience. The menu is a masterclass in Cantonese favorites, offering everything from delicate dim sum to lavish seafood dishes. Signature items like the Peking duck and lobster noodles are expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The wine and tea selections are extensive, perfectly complementing the sophisticated flavors of the meal. Service is polished and attentive, with staff ready to recommend pairings and explain dishes in detail. The private dining rooms offer an intimate option for family gatherings or business meetings. Dining at Kabin feels like stepping into another world—one where every bite is crafted with care and tradition. It’s a top choice for those seeking a memorable, high-end meal in the heart of Saigon.

LOCATION: Lagom Café - Belgian Beer & Coffee Lounge
Address: 36 Ton That Thiep Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Belgian beers and specialty coffee in a cozy lounge.
Long Description: Lagom Café is a stylish blend of cozy café culture and lively beer lounge tucked away in Ho Chi Minh City. Known for its relaxed atmosphere, Lagom offers a refreshing selection of craft Belgian beers alongside expertly brewed coffee. The decor is a harmonious mix of Scandinavian minimalism and warm, rustic touches, making it a great spot to unwind at any time of day. Whether you’re looking to enjoy a slow morning with a latte or a lively evening with a Trappist ale, Lagom has you covered. Their food menu, featuring gourmet snacks and hearty platters, pairs beautifully with both coffee and beer. The staff is friendly and passionate, always ready with a recommendation for your next drink. Regular events like live music nights and beer tasting sessions add to the charm. Lagom embodies the Swedish idea of "just enough"—perfectly balanced, never too much. It’s a must-visit for those who love good drinks, good vibes, and good company.

Address: 146E Ly Chinh Thang Street, Ward 7, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Hearty beef noodle soup with rich broth.
Long Description: Pho Bo Phu Gia is a cherished name among pho aficionados in Saigon, celebrated for its authentic northern-style beef pho. The broth is light, clear, and deeply aromatic, showcasing the purity of traditional Hanoi flavors. Each bowl is generously packed with tender beef cuts and firm, silky noodles, topped with green onions for a fresh bite. Unlike southern pho, here the seasoning is more subtle, allowing the natural sweetness of the beef to shine through. The setting is no-frills, typical of the best local eateries, focusing entirely on the quality of the food. Service is brisk but friendly, perfect for those craving a quick, satisfying meal. Portions are hearty yet leave you wanting just one more sip of broth. Pho Bo Phu Gia feels like a little piece of northern Vietnam nestled in the bustling streets of Saigon. It’s a must-try for anyone wanting to taste pho the way it was meant to be.

Address: 84 Nguyen Thi Minh Khai Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Tender beef stew with a traditional twist.
Long Description: Bo Kho Ganh at 84 Nguyen Thi Minh Khai is a local treasure for fans of hearty, flavorful Vietnamese beef stew. Their bò kho (beef stew) is rich, aromatic, and cooked to perfection, with beef chunks so tender they melt in your mouth. The broth is a beautiful blend of star anise, cinnamon, lemongrass, and tomatoes, resulting in a comforting, slightly sweet flavor profile. You can enjoy it with a warm, crispy baguette for dipping or slurp it over a bowl of soft rice noodles. The atmosphere is casual and bustling, full of regulars who know exactly where to find the best stew in town. Portions are generous, making it a satisfying meal any time of the day. Prices are affordable, offering incredible value for such a delicious, slow-cooked dish. Service is fast and efficient, ideal for busy lunches or relaxed dinners. Bo Kho Ganh is pure comfort food, Vietnamese style, and a must-visit for stew lovers.

LOCATION: Ho Chi Minh City Post Office
Address: 2 Cong Xa Paris Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Iconic post office designed by Gustave Eiffel.
Long Description: The Ho Chi Minh City Post Office is an architectural masterpiece and a must-see for visitors to the city. Built in the late 19th century during French colonial rule, this beautiful building combines French colonial and Gothic design, with its grand arched entrance and intricate ironwork. Inside, you’re greeted by high vaulted ceilings and rows of antique wooden booths that still serve as functional counters for postal services today. The large map of southern Vietnam painted on the wall adds a historical touch, making it a popular spot for photographs. It’s not just a post office—it's also a piece of Saigon’s history, blending the past and present seamlessly. Many visitors stop by not only to send postcards but also to admire the unique architectural details and vibrant atmosphere. The surrounding area is filled with old-world charm, with cafes and shops nearby where you can relax after a visit. Whether you're sending a letter or simply marveling at the building, it’s an iconic landmark in the city.

Address: 55C Nguyen Thi Minh Khai Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A peaceful green park in the city center.
Long Description: Tao Dan Park is a serene green space in the heart of District 1, offering a tranquil escape from the bustle of the city. The park is a popular spot for morning joggers, tai chi practitioners, and families seeking a quiet place to relax. The large trees and shady paths provide a cool retreat, while the flower gardens add a burst of color throughout the year. A highlight is the massive collection of sculptures scattered around the park, adding a whimsical touch to the peaceful surroundings. The park is especially lively in the early mornings, with locals practicing their daily exercises, and in the evenings when it’s cooler, you’ll find couples and friends strolling under the stars. There's also a small pond and a few benches where you can sit and watch the world go by. Tao Dan Park is simple, but it offers a much-needed break from the city's fast pace. It’s the kind of place that’s perfect for a reflective walk or a moment of rest. If you’re in the area, it’s definitely worth a visit.
open_hour: Open 24/7; best visited during daylight hours

Address: Nguyen Van Binh Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A charming street lined with bookstores and cafes.
Long Description: Đường Sách (Book Street) is a unique cultural hub located just off Nguyen Hue Walking Street, where literature lovers can immerse themselves in the world of books. This vibrant street is lined with dozens of bookshops, each offering a mix of Vietnamese and foreign literature, art books, travel guides, and even rare collector’s editions. The atmosphere here is calm and inviting, with many bookstores featuring cozy reading corners where you can relax with a book and a cup of coffee. The street is not only about books—there are occasional book launches, author talks, and exhibitions, making it a dynamic place for cultural exchange. For bookworms and curious wanderers, it’s a place to slow down and dive into a good read. Visitors often stroll through the pedestrianized zone, picking up a novel or chatting with the friendly shop owners. It’s a rare oasis for the love of reading in the heart of the city. Whether you’re looking for a book or just want to enjoy the peaceful vibe, Đường Sách is a must-visit for a literary adventure.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending
open_hour: Open 24/7; best visited during daylight hours

Address: 1 Cong Xa Paris Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Historic cathedral with stunning French architecture.
Long Description: The Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica of Saigon, or Nhà Thờ Đức Bà, is one of the most iconic landmarks in Ho Chi Minh City. Built by the French in the late 19th century, this majestic cathedral stands proudly in the center of District 1 with its twin bell towers reaching towards the sky. The red brick facade, stained glass windows, and intricate details showcase the architectural grandeur of the colonial era. It’s a peaceful spot to pause and take in the beauty, whether you’re admiring the cathedral from the outside or stepping inside to experience the serenity of its interior. The cathedral is still an active place of worship, with regular mass services and occasional special events. Its location in the heart of the city makes it a perfect starting point for sightseeing, as it’s surrounded by bustling streets, cafes, and shops. The area around the church is also great for photography, especially in the early morning or late afternoon when the light is perfect. For a glimpse into Saigon’s French heritage and its religious history, Nhà Thờ Đức Bà is an essential stop.

Address: 1 Nguyen Tat Thanh Street, Ward 12, District 4, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Historic port museum with Saigon River views.
Long Description: Bến Nhà Rồng, or the Saigon River Port, is a historical landmark that holds deep significance in Vietnam’s colonial past. Located along the Saigon River, this former customs house is most famous for being the place where Ho Chi Minh (then known as Nguyen Ai Quoc) boarded a ship to leave Vietnam in 1911, marking the beginning of his revolutionary journey. The building itself is an elegant blend of Western colonial architecture and Eastern design, with arched windows, large columns, and intricate decorations. Today, Bến Nhà Rồng houses the Ho Chi Minh Museum, which showcases historical artifacts, documents, and personal items related to the leader’s life. The riverside location adds a sense of nostalgia, as you can imagine how different the area must have looked a century ago. Whether you're a history enthusiast or just enjoying a scenic walk along the river, this place offers a glimpse into Vietnam’s path to independence. It’s a peaceful and educational stop that’s rich in both history and cultural importance.

Address: 135 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: The iconic Reunification Palace rich in history.
Long Description: The Independence Palace, or Dinh Độc Lập, is a symbol of Vietnam’s turbulent history and its path to reunification. Located in the heart of District 1, this grand building was once the presidential residence and workplace during the Vietnam War. Its design, a mix of 1960s modernism and traditional Vietnamese elements, makes it stand out as a unique piece of architecture. The interior of the palace is a fascinating time capsule, with rooms furnished just as they were when the palace was evacuated in 1975, marking the end of the war. Visitors can explore the luxurious chambers, including the President's office, the banquet hall, and the iconic war rooms in the basement, complete with a network of bunkers and control centers. The palace grounds also include lush gardens, a pool, and a helipad—reminders of a bygone era. It’s an important site for anyone looking to understand the history and political changes that shaped modern Vietnam. Whether you’re interested in history, architecture, or both, Dinh Độc Lập is an unmissable landmark.

Address: 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A large zoo and botanical garden in the city.
Long Description: Thảo Cầm Viên, or the Saigon Zoo and Botanical Gardens, is one of the oldest zoos in the world, having been established in 1865. Nestled in the heart of the city, this lush, green space is a favorite for both locals and visitors seeking a break from the urban rush. The zoo is home to a wide variety of animals, including exotic species like tigers, elephants, and monkeys, along with a number of native Vietnamese animals. In addition to the zoo, the botanical gardens feature beautifully landscaped areas with rare plants and flowers, perfect for a leisurely stroll. The park has a nostalgic charm, with older structures that have remained since colonial times. Families enjoy picnics, and children especially love the animal exhibits and playgrounds. It's a perfect blend of nature and nostalgia, providing an educational and peaceful escape. Whether you're learning about wildlife or simply enjoying the greenery, Thảo Cầm Viên offers a refreshing break from the bustling streets of Saigon.

Address: 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Museum showcasing Vietnam’s fascinating history.
Long Description: The Museum of Vietnamese History, or Bảo Tàng Lịch Sử, is a treasure trove of artifacts that tell the story of Vietnam’s rich past. Housed in a stunning colonial building, the museum offers a comprehensive look at the country’s ancient cultures, from the earliest Stone Age to the dynastic periods and the struggles of more recent history. Its extensive collection includes ancient ceramics, statues, weapons, and religious artifacts, all displayed in beautifully designed exhibit halls. One of the highlights is the impressive collection of Cham sculptures, which reflect the artistic and cultural achievements of the Champa Kingdom. The museum also provides insightful exhibits about Vietnam’s revolutionary struggles, including the French colonial era and the Vietnam War. It’s a fantastic place for history buffs or anyone looking to gain a deeper understanding of Vietnam’s journey through time. With its central location, it’s an easy stop for visitors exploring District 1. If you’re in the mood for a cultural deep dive, Bảo Tàng Lịch Sử is the place to go.

Address: Phu Hiep Hamlet, Phu My Hung Commune, Cu Chi District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Explore the historic underground tunnels of Cu Chi.
Long Description: The Cu Chi Tunnels are one of the most remarkable and poignant historical sites in Vietnam, offering a glimpse into the incredible ingenuity and resilience of the Vietnamese people during the Vietnam War. Located about 60 kilometers from Ho Chi Minh City, these vast underground networks were used by the Viet Cong as a base of operations, with miles of tunnels connecting living quarters, kitchens, hospitals, and storage rooms. A visit to the tunnels is an eye-opening experience, where you can crawl through narrow passages, view traps and secret entrances, and learn how the tunnels were constructed and maintained. The Cu Chi Tunnels offer a powerful, immersive way to understand the wartime conditions and the resourcefulness required to survive. The site is equipped with educational displays, guides, and even demonstrations of the old tactics used by the Viet Cong. The surrounding area is peaceful now, with trees and nature offering a stark contrast to the history of conflict that unfolded here. It’s a must-visit for anyone interested in the history of the Vietnam War and the resilience of its people.

Address: 710 Nguyen Trai Street, Ward 11, District 5, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Beautiful temple honoring the sea goddess.
Long Description: Ba Thien Hau Temple is one of the oldest and most spiritually significant temples in Ho Chi Minh City. Dedicated to the sea goddess Mazu, the protector of sailors, this temple is a beautiful example of Chinese architecture and devotion. Walking through its intricate entrance, visitors are immediately drawn into a world of carved woodwork, ornate altars, and swirling incense. The roof is decorated with colorful porcelain figures depicting ancient legends and scenes from Chinese folklore. Despite its location in bustling District 5, the temple offers a peaceful escape, with a quiet, contemplative atmosphere. Locals come here to pray for blessings, safe travels, and family well-being. Photography is welcome but always appreciated with respect, given the sacred nature of the space. During festivals like Tet Nguyen Tieu, the temple becomes even more vibrant with colorful ceremonies. Visiting Ba Thien Hau Temple offers a glimpse into the spiritual heartbeat of Saigon’s Chinese community. It's a must-see for history lovers and culture seekers alike.

Address: 73 Mai Thi Luu Street, Da Kao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Peaceful Taoist temple known for its intricate carvings.
Long Description: The Jade Emperor Pagoda is a mystical, atmospheric temple tucked away in a leafy corner of District 1. Built in the early 20th century by the city’s Cantonese community, it is dedicated to the Jade Emperor, one of the most important figures in Taoism. The pagoda’s dark wooden interiors are filled with the scent of incense and illuminated by hundreds of candles, creating an almost otherworldly ambiance. Intricately carved statues of deities, demons, and mythical creatures watch over the worshippers. Each room and hallway tells a story, from the fierce generals guarding the gates to the sacred turtle pond outside. Locals often come here to pray for good fortune, love, and success in exams or business. The temple’s weathered charm and deep spirituality make it a fascinating place to explore. It remains one of Saigon’s most beloved religious sites, offering insight into the city’s rich cultural tapestry. Don't forget to make a wish when you visit!

Address: 40 Dien Hong Street, Ward 1, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A bustling local market full of authentic finds.
Long Description: Ba Chieu Market is a vibrant local market that captures the everyday energy of Saigon life. Located in Binh Thanh District, it’s less touristy than famous spots like Ben Thanh Market, offering a more authentic shopping experience. Here you’ll find everything from fresh produce and seafood to clothes, household goods, and street food stalls. The market buzzes with activity from early morning until late evening, with vendors calling out their prices and regulars haggling for the best deals. Its narrow, winding alleys are packed with colorful goods and mouth-watering aromas. Ba Chieu Market is especially known for its affordable clothing, making it a favorite spot for bargain hunters. The atmosphere is lively and friendly, with a real sense of community among shoppers and sellers. If you want to experience Saigon as the locals do, this market is the place to be. Bring small bills and a sense of adventure—you never know what treasures you’ll find!
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: Le Loi Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: The iconic market famous for souvenirs and food.
Long Description: Chợ Bến Thành is the iconic heart of Ho Chi Minh City, a bustling market that has been a focal point of the city for over a century. Located in District 1, this vibrant market is a sensory overload, with colorful stalls brimming with everything from fresh produce, fragrant herbs, and street food to handmade crafts, clothing, and souvenirs. The architecture of the market itself, with its distinctive clock tower, is a mix of French colonial style and traditional Vietnamese elements, making it a popular spot for tourists and locals alike. Walking through the market, you’ll encounter friendly vendors eager to show off their goods, offering a wide range of products at prices that can often be bargained down. For food lovers, Chợ Bến Thành is a paradise, with stalls serving local favorites like pho, bánh mì, and fresh fruit juices. The market is also a cultural melting pot, where you can witness the daily rhythms of Saigon life and explore the city’s rich culinary heritage. Whether you’re shopping for souvenirs, tasting local dishes, or simply taking in the vibrant atmosphere, Chợ Bến Thành is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the pulse of the city.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 30 Bo Bao Tan Thang Street, Son Ky Ward, Tan Phu District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Large shopping mall with diverse dining options.
Long Description: Aeon Mall is a modern shopping paradise on the outskirts of Ho Chi Minh City, offering a perfect blend of retail therapy, dining, and entertainment. Located in Tan Phu District, the mall is part of the Japanese Aeon Group and features a wide variety of stores, from global fashion brands to local shops, catering to every taste and budget. Inside, the spacious and bright layout makes for a comfortable shopping experience, with everything from electronics, beauty products, and toys to home goods and apparel. The food court is a highlight, with a diverse selection of eateries offering both international favorites and traditional Vietnamese dishes, making it a great spot for a meal or snack. For those looking to unwind, Aeon Mall also has a cinema, an ice skating rink, and an arcade, ensuring there’s something for everyone, no matter your age. It’s a family-friendly destination that combines entertainment with convenience, perfect for a day out with friends or family. With its modern design and variety of amenities, Aeon Mall is a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city while enjoying some leisurely shopping and fun.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 92-94 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Upscale mall with luxury brands and restaurants.
Long Description: Takashimaya Vietnam brings a touch of Japanese elegance to the heart of Saigon’s bustling shopping scene. Located within Saigon Centre, this luxury department store offers an upscale shopping experience with a wide range of international and local brands. The layout is spacious and beautifully designed, making browsing a pleasure rather than a chore. From designer fashion and beauty products to gourmet food and homeware, there’s something for everyone. The basement food court is a highlight, featuring a mix of Japanese delicacies and international cuisines. Service is excellent, with attentive staff providing the kind of thoughtful assistance Takashimaya is famous for. It’s also a great spot to cool down and relax after exploring the busy streets of District 1. Whether you’re window shopping or indulging in a shopping spree, Takashimaya offers a premium experience. It’s perfect for those who appreciate quality, style, and a touch of Japanese hospitality.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 34 Le Duan Boulevard, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: Shopping center with fashion and lifestyle shops.
Long Description: Diamond Plaza is one of Saigon’s iconic shopping and entertainment complexes, blending old-world charm with modern luxury. Housed in a beautiful colonial-style building near Notre Dame Cathedral, Diamond Plaza offers a mix of high-end retail, dining, and leisure options. Shoppers can browse luxury brands, jewelry, cosmetics, and even an upscale bookstore all under one roof. The complex also features a bowling alley, a cinema, and several excellent restaurants and cafes. Its clean, elegant design and relaxed atmosphere make it a favorite spot for both locals and expats. The views from the upper floors offer lovely glimpses of the city’s historic landmarks. Diamond Plaza is more than just a mall—it’s a lifestyle destination where you can shop, dine, and play in style. Whether you're looking for a fashionable new outfit or simply a comfortable place to unwind, this classic venue delivers. It’s a polished yet inviting piece of Saigon’s urban life.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 77 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A shopping center known for affordable fashion.
Long Description: Saigon Square is a bustling shopping haven for bargain hunters and savvy shoppers in Ho Chi Minh City. With two main locations in District 1, it’s famous for offering name-brand clothing, accessories, and souvenirs at significantly lower prices than elsewhere. The atmosphere inside is lively and a bit chaotic, with small stalls packed closely together, each showcasing a treasure trove of goods. Haggling is not just welcomed—it’s expected—so bring your best bargaining skills to score amazing deals. You'll find everything from sportswear and handbags to jewelry and electronics. Despite its somewhat unassuming appearance, Saigon Square is well-organized and air-conditioned, making shopping here comfortable even on hot days. It’s popular among both locals and tourists looking for quality items at great prices. Always double-check the quality of what you're buying, as replicas are common. For a fun and rewarding shopping experience, Saigon Square is hard to beat.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 42 Nguyen Hue Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A historic building filled with unique cafes.
Long Description: The Cafe Apartments is one of the most charming and unique spots in Ho Chi Minh City’s coffee scene. Housed in a once-residential building on Nguyen Hue Walking Street, each apartment unit has been transformed into a cozy café, boutique shop, or creative workspace. Climbing the old, slightly worn staircases feels like a mini-adventure, leading you to hidden gems on each floor. Each café has its own personality—some minimalist and chic, others colorful and eclectic. It’s the perfect place to sip coffee, enjoy desserts, or just soak up the artsy, laid-back vibe. Many of the cafes offer balconies with great views over the bustling pedestrian street below. The building’s vintage character and creative energy make it a popular spot for both locals and tourists alike. Whether you’re looking for the perfect Instagram shot or a peaceful place to read, The Cafe Apartments has something special for you. It’s a must-visit for lovers of unique urban spaces.
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 202 Hoang Van Thu Street, Ward 9, Phu Nhuan District, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A large supermarket offering local and imported goods.
Long Description: Big C Hoang Van Thu is a convenient and popular supermarket located near Tan Son Nhat Airport. It’s a spacious, air-conditioned store offering a wide variety of products, from fresh produce and groceries to clothing, electronics, and household goods. The prices are generally affordable, making it a favorite stop for both locals and travelers looking to stock up on essentials. The layout is easy to navigate, and there are plenty of local Vietnamese products alongside international brands. Many visitors also appreciate the small food court inside, serving quick and tasty Vietnamese meals. It’s a good place to get a taste of local shopping habits away from the more touristy areas. Friendly staff and a clean environment make the experience even more enjoyable. Big C is great if you want to grab some snacks, gifts, or even just see what everyday shopping in Vietnam looks like. Don't forget to bring your own shopping bags to be eco-friendly!
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: 336 Hai Ba Trung Street, Tan Dinh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: A colorful market famous for fabrics and foods.
Long Description: Tan Dinh Market is a colorful and bustling spot famous for its fabric stalls and local food offerings. Located in District 1 but slightly off the main tourist trail, this market is a treasure trove for anyone interested in textiles, with rows upon rows of vivid fabrics in every color and texture imaginable. Alongside the fabric vendors, you’ll find a vibrant mix of stalls selling fresh fruits, seafood, street food, and household items. The atmosphere is lively, with the sounds of bargaining, laughter, and scooters weaving through the narrow aisles. Prices are usually reasonable, but bargaining can get you even better deals. It’s also a fantastic place to sample authentic Vietnamese dishes like banh mi, pho, and sweet desserts. Unlike the more tourist-centric Ben Thanh Market, Tan Dinh feels more relaxed and local. It’s a wonderful glimpse into Saigon’s daily life. Plus, the nearby pink Tan Dinh Church is a perfect photo stop after your market visit!
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending

Address: Le Loi Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
Description: (Repeated) The central landmark market of Ho Chi Minh City.
Long Description: Ben Thanh Market is one of the most iconic landmarks of Ho Chi Minh City, a bustling maze of colorful stalls and energetic vendors. Located right in the heart of District 1, it’s a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience the city's lively shopping culture. Inside, you’ll find everything from souvenirs, handicrafts, and clothing to spices, dried foods, and street eats. The scent of incense mixes with the aroma of grilled meats and fresh herbs, creating a sensory overload in the best way. Vendors are friendly but persistent, and bargaining is part of the fun here. After sunset, the area around the market transforms into a vibrant night market, perfect for a relaxed evening stroll and food adventure. Although touristy, Ben Thanh Market still holds its charm with its historic architecture and buzzing energy. It's the kind of place where you can get lost—and love every minute of it. Just keep an eye on your belongings and dive into the experience!
Ticket Info: Free to visit; costs depend on personal spending
